column4: anyone know... if I patched my driver in the old kernel if the new kernel would have the previous patched driver or do I have to repatch it/
do you know where I can get the kernel source then?
ahh... hmm... 'sudo apt-get source linux-image-$(uname -r) I guess
Actually, how do you mean you patched the kernel? You edited a module's source code, and applied it?
I patched the module source for the b43 driver...
You should definitely file a bug though and submit your patch if it is a fix.
Not 100% it'll get in, but it'd save you some time if it does  :D
you have booted to the newest kernel?
then get to compiling the module  ;D
dpkg -L linux-headers-$(uname -r) ... they're in the right place... just compile.
there's nothing in there lol.  in the b43 place
